metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: In these chapters we will build an analog clock using HTML canvas.
content.html: In these chapters we will build an analog clock using HTML canvas.

content.text: The clock needs an HTML container. Create an HTML canvas:
content.html: The clock needs an HTML container. Create an HTML canvas:

content.code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

<body>


<canvas id="canvas" width="400"
height="400" style="background-color:#333"></canvas>


<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("canvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");
let radius = canvas.height / 2;
ctx.translate(radius, radius);
radius = radius * 0.90
drawClock();
function drawClock() {
ctx.arc(0, 0, radius, 0 , 2 * Math.PI);
ctx.fillStyle = "white";
ctx.fill();
}
</script>


</body>
</html>
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<canvas id="canvas" width="400" height="400" style="background-color:#333"></canvas>

<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("canvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");
let radius = canvas.height / 2;
ctx.translate(radius, radius);
radius = radius * 0.90
drawClock();

function drawClock() {
  ctx.arc(0, 0, radius, 0 , 2 * Math.PI);
  ctx.fillStyle = "white";
  ctx.fill();
}
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Add an HTML <canvas> element to your page:
content.html: Add an HTML <canvas> element to your page:

content.code_html: <canvas id="canvas" width="400" height="400" style="background-color:#333"></canvas>

content.text: Create a canvas object (const canvas) the HTML canvas element:
content.html: Create a canvas object (const canvas) the HTML canvas element:

content.code_html: const canvas = document.getElementById("canvas");

content.text: Create a 2d drawing object (const ctx) for the canvas object:
content.html: Create a 2d drawing object (const ctx) for the canvas object:

content.code_html: const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

content.text: Calculate the clock radius, using the height of the canvas:
content.html: Calculate the clock radius, using the height of the canvas:

content.code_html: let radius = canvas.height / 2;

content.text: Using the canvas height to calculate the clock radius, makes the clock work for all canvas sizes.
content.html: Using the canvas height to calculate the clock radius, makes the clock work for all canvas sizes.

content.text: Remap the (0,0) position (of the drawing object) to the center of the canvas:
content.html: Remap the (0,0) position (of the drawing object) to the center of the canvas:

content.code_html: ctx.translate(radius, radius);

content.text: Reduce the clock radius (to 90%) to draw the clock well inside the canvas:
content.html: Reduce the clock radius (to 90%) to draw the clock well inside the canvas:

content.code_html: radius = radius * 0.90;

content.text: Create a function to draw the clock:
content.html: Create a function to draw the clock:

content.code_html:
function drawClock() {
  ctx.arc(0, 0, radius, 0 , 2 * Math.PI);
  ctx.fillStyle = "white";
  ctx.fill();
}
